If youre into Ramen you will not be disappointed.  Highly recommended

wHFhb-y_oUgy7uUhFvEmUQ.text: Short: Decent food, good prices, but didn't leave me super happy.  The long:  Have been meaning to hit this place for a while after seeing pretty good reviews. Arrived and was greeted warmly and told to sit anywhere. The place is littered with their "Happy Hour" special and a ad to add extra noodles. Otherwise the place is rather bland for a ramen shop; can't complain.   I was hungry, so I ordered the Deluxe ramen which has extra chashu (roasted pork slices), cabbage, bean sprouts, eggs, and corn on top of the normal toppings. Shoyu (soy sauce) broth with thinker noodles. Then I ordered a serving of karaage and (a surprise!) takoyaki. For $3 on happy hour for the sides, I wasn't expecting the amount of food I'd get for the sides; the karaage was a meal on its own with the chicken and side salad, and the takoyaki was small but had enough of them to feel worth it. Both were fine, not amazing. I've had better karaage at Fukumimi ramen. and better takoyaki at festivals, but not bad for the price.  As for the ramen: It's the worse I've had. I'm grading it against Monta and Sora ramen, so it's not terrible, but just doesn't make me rave. The broth isn't very complex and lacks punch. The chashu, while there was a lot, isn't very flavorful. The rest of the toppings on the ramen were simple and easy to add, but they didn't make this bowl feel like a "Deluxe" special from a ramen shop, more so a hodgepodge of toppings on decent ramen.   In the end, I left this place stuffed and content, but not very happy. The service is good, the prices are decent (Happy hour sides are great), the food is just lacking in overall flavor and depth.   I'll try this place again, but I suggest either Monta, Sora, Fukumimi, or Misoya Tomi ramen first.

hRGccvYnziPKWoTpXu6hag.text: Like others, I found this place on semi-accident.  Didn't want to wait at Monta, realized this place was close, etc and so on.  This is now my go-to ramen place in town.  Great food, quick service, really affordable.  Really can't say a bad word about the place.

sRinTUqqqvM5IqaqlNmtAg.text: If you know what an authentic Japanese Style Ramen is, this is THE place to go.  I'm from Japan, I know how the ramen-ya (restaurant) should be. Even my friends who were visiting from Japan approved  their Tonkotsu soup. It is authentically flavorful!  You know some Tonkotsu soup is very smelly and taste some kind of weird bitter flavor if you came across a ramen cooked by cooks who don't know the real Tonkotsu flavor.  Ramen soup is NOT built a day.  Certain trainings are required, enormous days and hours you have to spend to be a real Ramen cook. The owner must be a hard worker, and you will feel their prides and spirits in one bowl of noodles and soup.   Try their "Real" Ramen!

yJSWhxpl_tMfzdRjzZZN0w.text: Great ramen, great gyoza, and fried rice was made me feel like go back Japan ! Waitress Emika was so great service and attentive ! Cute nice girl. Owner was very young nice dude also! I highly recomemded this ramen shop!!!!

yxSCbXA7ViGYXIU2oHDt5A.text: Service, service, service!  We came in during happy hour and most of the side items were reduced.  It was all very tasty and delicious.  The ramen was fantastic.  Had the spicy ramen and it has enough spice and flavor.  It wasn't salty at all.  Will be back next time in town.

w21JH0vDq49_Vf9Iw4ob8w.text: First off, we struggled to find this place at night.  That store sign is very difficult to read. Or we are just blind.  Place is very lovely looking and decorated to suit the theme.  Very similar to the other ramen houses.  Not too packed on a Saturday night.  Menu had several choices, but tonight we were aiming for spicy.  My friend got the spicy miso and a extra spicy for myself.  *Nice little check-in bonus (1 free drink).  Now the only complaint I have is that we have to add toppings?  I was a little confused since the description for my miso said ground beef.. So I added chashu.  My ramen obviously became expensive now.. Extra cost for extra spicy and chashu.  This bowl of soup better be worth it.   After several slurps, the spiciness  began to kick in.  Very good tasting broth, but I did not feel like it was anything special.  The spiciness was only a tad more than the regular.  The thick noodles were a nice change since we are used to getting thin types at the other places.  Service was excellent since our waitress was consistently coming around to see if we were doing okay.    Overall, this place is not bad in my book.  It just that there are plenty of ramen houses in this area.

H205MpLMkx24OMch07Mwog.text: The ramen was cooked perfectly. I ordered the curry ramen and the broth wasn't watered down, I'd even wager to say it was a little rich for my taste. Overall, nearly perfect ramen.  The service here was the main selling point. Our server was quirky, friendly, and in general seemed happy to be there. Of course this was during the non-busy hours, so that could change.  Overall it was delicious ramen with great service. The place isn't fancy but it did feel welcoming, so take that for how you will.  Also the portion sizes were good. My friend got a deluxe ramen and it was massive.

Nyr3WYabDRj8d7_BvF7EOw.text: Ramen is good!! Not salty like Monta & Ramen Sora. Good service too. Will definitely come back for more. Plus i got a free drink just by checking in! Woohoo!!

GrbT0i64_mcyNBhLC4ARgQ.text: Very nice and kind waiter. Decent ramen at a reasonable price. Short wait, no line. Kimchi fried rice is delicious and since there is not many people it's pretty quiet. A nice place to hang out and eat lunch with friends, or by yourself if you prefer

gw9JYfgH9i02mGL1bmuSew.text: This ramen spot has a wide selection of different ramen broths and toppings, which is really cool.  They had about 7 different types of broth and each broth had a different combination of toppings, so make sure you look at the toppings to see if your favorite thing is in there.  I ended up getting a shio ramen and added an egg and kikurage (my favorite topping of all time).  I had never had this type of broth before, and it was light and fresh.  It reminded me of the broth that comes in a Cup of Noodles, and I mean that in a good way because I love Cup of Noodles.  My husband got a tonkotsu broth which was really rich, thick, and creamy.  Ramen Tatsu is a good little ramen spot and offers a free soda with your Yelp check in!

Shio tasted off to her and she felt it had too much oil floating on top. I gave her the rest of my broth for her noodles she liked that much better. Service was great. HPgFb6M3NpH_mgco3_foKA.text: This restaurant is excellent! The food is exactly how I expected and more! I haven't had good food like this in a long time. This place will be my new go-to for ramen. I also love how helpful and kind the waitresses are.

e-90tigKiCAWmsI15Fn_Lw.text: I have been to many ramen places but this is  the most humble and delicious ramen I have ever had. The fusion and intricate favor of the habanero spice and soup of spicy tonkotsu ramen one to remember and crave. If I am into some good Japanese ramen or rice, I go here.

cZFW8F1tzQKEFHEX7bfqMw.text: the noodle is okay but they are pretty slowly. We sit there and waited foods for over 30 mins...

lnnkFXs1KVfEK_5sR0C8NQ.text: Good service. Good food. Love their happy hour menu. This is place is better than Monta, but not sure why it's less busy.

QITq8fZ-ycqqHPX_B1yBfg.text: Customer service is awful. The food alone would have gotten a four star. However, we ordered appetizers and ramen, and the appetizers arrived when I was nearly finished with my ramen. We then waited for our check, long enough to write this review.

XZATB0KK_AsQTy-GXXFBZw.text: The first time we came they had just opened and were empty, but we lived the food. Tonight they were packed and the noodles are still amazing! My favorite noodle house

jcOiPBSU9dHibpmtZ03tNQ.text: - I like this place even more than I like Monta Ramen. - The broths for their different types of ramen are all delicious! - Their ramen also comes with a good amount of complimentary garnishes (different types of ramen come with a different set of garnishes). - I also like their fried rice. - Each table has 3 different sauce bottles so that you can make your own dipping sauce. - Their gyoza is pan fried, not deep fried (I like deep fried better). - Their soft drinks are in a can, as opposed to a soda machine, so no free refills. - We're always seated right away.  - And it's not claustrophobic like at Monta Ramen. - Servers are fast, friendly, and attentive. - They have happy hour for food as well as drinks. - This is my new favorite ramen place!

dQtfaUzKgzbTJQYkwycEww.text: Love that it is hidden away from the other ramen houses on spring mountain. Food is tasty,  I like the shoyu broth but have also enjoyed miso. My son loves the curry,  has good flavor just no potatoes with it.  Doesn't stop him from ordering it everytime. Prices are great, doesn't hurt your pocket.  Atmosphere is nice and cozy,  small like other ramen spots but never crowded when we come so not stuffy.

BaYlaRVp5pPtJfURRNLHeA.text: Had dinner here, it was ok, nothing special about it, but the food was not bad also. would i come back here? I probably will, if there was no other option. Their food is not really something i would crave, I definitely have been to much better ramen places, but if those are full, this place will do.

T2SaNw1WdcEnWzTN2ua66Q.text: Stuffed! Had Ramen Tonkutsu with the most perfectly hard boiled egg, fried rice, gyoza.  Place seems to have the right balance in most of their dishes. Love they they have kimchee on the menu. Even so everything seems to be hard core japanese, kimchee and Ramen is just a brilliant combo. noodles perfectly cooled and paired. They use different noodle thickness for different soups as I discovered tonight.

syvhforVLJQTwRtOX8gi0Q.text: This is a fabulous authentic Ramen restaurant. I have searched all over the US since my time as a student in Japan 20 years ago but never found anything that has come as close as this. The Shio Ramen was light and flavorful. The Tako Yaki reminded me of summer festival street stalls. The curry rice was delicious. I will come back here the next time in Vegas over any over priced fancy Japanese food establishment on the Strip.

McF-hfK0NIOfIhVMYD-XBA.text: Nice little ramen joint that is kind of hidden. Definitely an enjoyable atmosphere. They had a nice soundtrack and ambience with a quiet atmosphere. They don't serve fountain drinks here, we were given our drinks in a can, so that was a bit of a turn off, but obviously nothing that would make me not want to eat at a place (haha).  I ordered the shoyu ramen and a side order of Katsu. Both of them were great and definitely worth the try. The portions were very good and I left there full. The other 2 in my party struggled to finish, so that's a great sign on my opinion. The ramen was very well priced and so were all of the sides. I will definitely be stopping in for a bowl of ramen again, I'm interested in the other options.

1HFJE52p68dCg6QItitJXw.text: As a tonkotsu ramen aficionado, I'm constantly on the lookout for the next great ramen-ya, especially one that can rival the best in LA, or dare to dream, the ones in Hakata, Fukuoka, Japan. It was with great excitement that I noticed their preopening announcement, and we set out to try them for a weekend lunch. Upon entering the restaurant, we noted a clean Spartan aesthetic but the wooden benches were quite hard and mildly uncomfortable. The menu was simple and straightforward. We asked the waitress what the Tatsu ramen was, and she explained it is their tonkotsu with additional chashu (6 vs 2 pieces). We went ahead and ordered the tonkotsu ($7.77) and Tatsu ($10.77) ramen. Our bowls came out quickly and were accompanied by seaweed, ginger, a tiny bit of green onion and sesame, but no egg. Surprisingly, there didn't seem to be an option to add an egg, or other accompaniments, i.e. additional green onion, corn, etc. Interestingly, the shio and shoyu versions appear to come with an egg though.  While it looked promising initially with the proper thin white ramen noodles, our experience was underwhelming. First off, the noodles were overcooked and not al dente or firm enough. While the amount of noodles was adequate, the amount of broth was on the skimpy side and could have been served hotter. (Usually the better ramen joints serve their broth piping hot so that it is still plenty warm by the time you're finishing your meal.) The porky flavor and richness of the broth was ok but not something you would want to slurp up every last drop of. The chashu was not quite tender enough, a bit too fatty (that I was compelled to pick off the fatty parts), and somewhat bland at the same time. It was also odd that when I asked for shichimi togarashi (Japanese chili powder and a classic condiment), they only had chili oil available.  In the end, Ramen Tatsu was just okay for us. It is better than much of the local competition, but doesn't induce any cravings to return.

mOnJ_JwAeNibfvKiSycYrQ.text: I had high hopes for this place....but I left slightly disappointed.  We'll start with the good, the decor is simple with clean lines and they have a few items that I will be looking forward to in the future, such as karaage and takoyaki!  I love takoyaki, so if they get that going and it tastes good, I might just stop by for that by itself and a char siu bowl.  Now for the not so good, I tried the Tatsu Ramen which has a tonkatsu broth with 5-6 pieces of char siu and a piece of seaweed.  I felt everything was a little bland and under seasoned.  The soup base tasted slightly watery and could have used just a pinch of salt to bring the flavor out a little better.  I think this was a general consensus, since I heard the elderly couple next to us actually tell the waiter that they felt their Miso Ramen needed salt.  The pork belly was thicker cut, similar to Ramen Sora, but marbled in fat like Monta's.  However, again the pork lacked seasoning.  They also put the ginger in the bowl for you, instead of having on the side...which i dislike since ginger is pretty overpowering and a personal preference.  They also have the option of two different types of noodles, thick and thin.....I ordered the thick noodles and felt they were a little soggy already by the time I started eating....So unfortunately at this point, I will be returning to my old stomping grounds of Monta and Ramen Sora.

ManvRL0jyDBjqqtFYt2CJQ.text: I love this place! The tonkotsu shoyu ramen is damn good! The service is awesome and quick! I go here everytime I want ramen! Must go!

eRxkpJr-SD1G74v_tG2DHQ.text: My first foray into ramen and I am very impressed. Must do this again soon to try out rest of the menu. Had the tonkatsu shoyu ramen, the broth was very rich and flavorful as was the pork slices. You won't be disappointed.

H7llinlvBXiEvE_eMtUVlg.text: Hands down, very tasty ramen. Good broth and ofcourse friendly staff. They have Asahi draft too:)

ifAuMFGJWpocsdmO6MLs3Q.text: This place has some of the best ramen in town! The staff is always friendly, their fried rice is amazing, and the curry ramen is an absolute must. A favorite date night spot for sure.

NntQ41iuiYjva3ZcBuOINg.text: I went here for the first time with friends during our lunch break.  The place itself is very clean and the decor of the restaurant is very well done. When we got to Ramen Tatsu, there was a nice Japanese lady sweeping the front. We asked if they were open and she cheerfully said yes.  We walked in and we were the only customers here. By the time we left, however, more people came.  I ordered to tonkotsu shoyu ramen along with one of my friends. They cost $7.77. The other friend got the spicy miso, which was slightly pricier at a little over $8.  The same lady we saw sweeping the front also got us our drinks and took our order. She was really friendly, smiled a lot, and even took our picture for us.  Shame on me for forgetting to take a picture of my bowl of ramen, but it looked so good. I couldn't stop myself from digging right in.  The broth was tasty and had just the right amount of saltiness. The noodles were good as well. I just wish there was more pork. 2 slices isn't enough for such a big serving of ramen.  I'm adding Ramen Tatsu to my list of ramen spots. I like it even more because it seems it's owned and run by a family.

PpITvAOfWzKgQKl1-vKZlQ.text: This was a glorious and unexpected experience. The broth was so rich and made me a ramen fan. They had copious and flavorful side dishes like chicken kaarage and fried rice. I stuffed myself and felt glorious afterward. I definitely will make a point to come back the next time I am in town.

PRIb81SVspA2P4JuFJLFKQ.text: Food is good... Price is good....  Portion is good... If you want to have large bowl, you can choose deluxe....

suwPCS3P6yjzixqnPdcVXg.text: A quick stop at Monta revealed a 45 minute wait, so we continued up the road and found Ramen Tatsu. Larger, more open restaurant tastefully decorated, and not that crowded. There were 11 other people there and plenty of space for more.   Ramen was delicious. I got extra chasui and my friend went with an extra egg. Very very good. 4.5 easy for flavor.  Its funny when I look back at my starving college days of eating Top Ramen. I absolutely hated it but it was all I could afford. Now I find myself enjoying Ramen at the variety of places around town. Who knew???   This place is clean. A little slower with the food coming out than others, but that's ok. Service was really friendly. I'd eat here again.  Located in the same shopping area as Cafe Moda, District One, Chada Thai.....this is a great shopping area for foodies!!

The women was really friendly. I am so appreciate her services.  When we visit this restaurant,there was happyhour. We ordered takoyaki on the side. But wish you guys open more late..!!

pE2oyW6dQujNgJnUQ66LnA.text: Restaurant size is pretty small but extremely cozy and homey! The staff member is extremely nice and super helpful!   My sibling and I were craving ramen for the longest time and we didn't have a chance to eat it... Until now!   I got the spicy miso with an egg and my sibling got something (I totally forgot) that thhe made spicy with an egg as well. We both picked the ones with the thick noodles and it was HEAVENLY!!   The ramen broth is cooked long and slow in a slew of veggies and bone broth so that it is nice and creamy. The noodles are the right consistency that slurp right off your spoon to your mouth. Even better, the egg was cooked to PERFECTION! Soft yolk, hard boiled white and the yolk had a tiny but of juice left but just oh so creamy in your mouth.  This place is a must try if you are craving ramen or if it's a gloomy day or cold day or any day for that matter of fact! I suggest adding an egg!!!

J9dBWQAJ_kh5pc3snF6VLg.text: I love their curry. I ordered curry rice and gyoza. The curry was very flavourful. The consistency of the curry sauce was perfect. The gyoza was juicy, the skin was slightly too burnt though. Overall, the food was good. Will definitely come back.

cjqeU0tOc5yzBDDgff2pMw.text: Food/Cost: We usually stop by the Asian BBQ restaurant next door but since it was closed for vacation we decided to come here. I'm glad we did! The Ramen were full of flavors where you know they have been boiling that pork bone for a long time! That was makes a True Ramen and not bland and make it up with lots of salt and MSG etc. Cost was very descent compared to many generic Ramen places. For the taste and flavors in this place, its more worth paying a little bit more anyway for the amount of time it takes to make the soup taste that way. The portion of kimchi fried rice we ordered was a bit small for the price we paid. Flavor was good but nothing to rave about. Has a bit of sour flavor too due to the Kimchi which was meh. Will think twice before ordering that again though. I would just stick with the Ramen. Haven't tried the other stuff though.   Service: The one and only lady I see working works like a champ! The place is small but enough capacity where I think it will really help to have 2 people. She took orders, brought your food, refill waters without you even asking and get your check. Even with all that by herself, she was still quick at her service. Wow! It wasn't until toward the end, we saw another lady walked out to help. I hope she was just taking a little break because otherwise, the heck you will leave a partner in chaos by herself?  Ambiance: Cute little place with the generic Japanese theme. Not much decor but enough to get the idea your at a Japanese restaurant. Place is clean and AC was good enough to bring the mood to eat hot soupy Ramen at 105F outside!

HAzKqhAOhN9gi_PVBBBxbg.text: Having gone a few times, I was a bit disappointed at the last two visits. They really need to hire at least one more waitress/waiter. They only have one waiting on all tables and greeting customers to their table. Because of this, service is super slow. You have to wait quite some time to be seated (they don't clean right away after someone leaves), some time for them to take your order, and some time to get your check.  For that -1 star.  With this restaurant being busy and popular especially in this plaza, it would be helpful if they could have one more person working.   The last visit, the meat and egg really disappointed me. The meat was chewy and not tender and was filled with fat and skin instead of meat.  The soft boiled egg was a bit over cooked as you can see from the yolk. The spoon had black marks on it and was dirty. For that -1 Star.   For something I initially enjoyed and would've given 5 stars, I was quite disappointed in my last two visits. Nonetheless I will return and hope to see improvements.

3oIWt5Br_K9-BH1UByg3NQ.text: Great small quaint place away from the Strip. Love the little decor w models of old traditional Japanese shops. Had the spicy miso ramen (not kidding when they say spicy), kimchi fried rice, Asahi on draft, and the macaron ice cream sandwich. All in all, great lunch! Will come back again!

Rm0xzvNFeYJL7rEZ6ApG1g.text: Great place to come get ramen! My husband and I came to eat here one evening and I enjoyed the service, the menu was straight forward and when the ramen came it was perfect. I was left with a great impression on this place since we ordered gyoza as an appetizer and although it looked cooked, it wasn't. The server immediately took it back and had it re fired. I didn't mind waiting on those...I was glad to see the meat was fresh and wasn't frozen. lol The atmosphere in this place is very tiny, like a mom and pop shop but cozy. There were mini crafts displayed on the walls of all the little buildings. I liked it a lot! I like crafts. Lol but when the gyoza came back it was perfect and we did t even need sauce with it. :) they even removed it from our bill without us having to mention it. It was easy to tell that this place really cares about their customers! I'm glad we found this place while we were here for a short while!

fO9V2_kzy4bjs5YocLHK8g.text: There's so many ramen restaurants in town and this is one of my fav, indeed this is my fav!   Spicy miso & tonkotsu shoyu are my favorites.  Lately my hubby is addicted to spicy tonkotsu ramen as well.  All the ramen tasted delish, the broth was rich but not too salty, the ramen was al dente.  Yum!   I love their takoyaki, it's lightly crunch and crispy. Texture was amazing!  The seating there is very comfy and inviting, very authentic Japanese style, parking usually is easy.    I like the other ramen places too but most of them have a hectic parking situation or the line is ridiculously long.    They have happy hours during the weekday, 3-6pm, almost half price on the alcohol & most appetizers.  Love it!

W-i6FKnuU8yU2QxUznUpBA.text: After my first time here it became my new favorite spot. The food is great plus they have a variety of options outside of their ramen selection.  Their happy hour is from 3-6pm and you can get so much food starting at $3 (not including ramen).    All the servers I've had the past few times I've been here have been all very friendly!! I love how it's not as crowded as other ramen joints. Oh! And they serve Tsukumen. It's a Japanese noodle dish that I haven't found served anywhere else in Las Vegas (correct me if I'm wrong, really, I love Tsukumen). That's originally why I came here.

sXMi2IXukFkr8UaY_ozAaA.text: We tried this place for the first time. We like that you can pick the spice level. Decided to try the entry level and it had a good heat. Tried to tonkatsu, shoyu tonkatsu and miso all with entry level spice. All bowls had generous portions of noodles and so tasty. One of the better ramen places we've tried in Vegas would definitely come back the next we are in town.

Sqq-dBThUz-4xEZqn8nWuA.text: The Shoyu broth, pork and vegetables is the very best you will find outside of Japan.  (I was here with my daughter in-law who lived in Japan a couple years) We also had great fried rice, and excellent shumai dumpling. The curry Ramen I ordered was a hint of curry broth, pork and vegetables excellent if you like a light curry taste, this is not creamy.   Everything that I saw brought out was appealing. Personally I would try it all.  Service was quick because it seems that it is a family owned restaurant, therefore they care. I would say if you can be there before traditional 12 noon for lunch ,  and 6:30pm for dinner it is probably better since it is a small place.  Bon Appetite!

rU5WJpzwgk_Qslj4GTuycA.text: We found Tatsu by accident, because we were originally going to the shabu shabu place next to it but they weren't open yet. It was happy hour (3-6pm M-F) so we got some chicken karaage and gyoza for $3 instead of the usual $4.75/order. Both things were good, with the chicken being flavorful and the gyoza nice and crispy on the edges.   There are many options on the menu, including rice bowls. We ordered the deluxe ramen (egg, corn, bean sprouts, cabbage, seaweed, green onion, charsiu, thick noodles) and asked if we could get it with miso broth instead of the tonkotsu broth it usually comes with. Our waitress said yes, but neglected to mention that it was $1 extra. Not a big deal, but it would have been nice to know. The miso broth was okay but nothing to write home about. It tasted a bit watered down to me; I've had stronger, more flavorful miso broth from a packaged ramen from the Asian grocery.  What I did enjoy was the ample amount of vegetables that came with the ramen, as it made for a texturally interesting bowl. The charsiu was tender but oddly cold in the middle, as were the egg halves.   In short, Tatsu is a solid ramen shop if you're in the area, and they have a decent happy hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Ramen Tatsu - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miso deluxe ramen!
Photo of Ramen Tatsu - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour Monday- Friday 3pm-6pm except on national holidays

-HwSMypW6RrI2PRvhPUWOA.text: With all of the ramen there is in Chinatown now--it's hard to really find some good joints.   This place was pretty good. We wanted to find a new ramen place other than the usual spots.  It was pretty hoppin' for a Sunday early dinner. Which is always a good sign.  They have great prices and a pretty good selection of ramen.  I, myself, always love Miso broth. So I got the Miso Ramen and had them add an egg. It was really good. The broth was excellent.  They weren't my favorite noodles. They weren't as thick as I was hoping or as firm. Not perverted. Also, the pork here isn't the most tender. I love my pork in ramen to be very tender to where it falls apart easily. Otherwise, your face is over your ramen bowl and you're trying to tear it to peices without making a mess. Or you have to stuff the entire peice in your mouth and look like an idiot while you're eating...or you just look savage as fuck. So, depending on how you like your ramen--it will determine your experience, of course.   And I must say, the service here was excellent. All of the staff were very friendly and very upbeat. Our waitress was super happy and literally sang to us the names of what she was serving us. It made all of us laugh and enjoy our dinner much more. That's one thing that we don't see at the other ramen joints. Most of them are "get in and get out".   Overall, this place was pretty good. I'll definitely go back to try some other type of ramen.

photos.caption: Photo of Ramen Tatsu - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fuck yeah, Miso.

zsNVtqcIG5EN-GsUgUP8dw.text: Trying this place for the first time!! My wife had a taste for Ramen!! Checked yelp real quick and this one had high marks so why not. The staff is very friendly and the service was quick. We're vegetarian and needed to find a broth that wasn't made with a meat base. We ordered The Veggie Ramon with mushroom, corn, bean sprout, green onion and we added cabbage. You can dial up the spice. I'm a wimp so mine was zero and my wife was medium. First bite.... really tasty!! The combination of flavored blend very well! Spicy update!! My wife said Number 4 spice level is Spivey but also damn good!! (She's sucking in air as I type this)  overall great place to eat!!

TzzJVqTeJRyqG06JU05S1w.text: I come to LV once every few months to visit family and this is a must go! The staff are super nice. You can expect Japanese level of politeness here and after living in Japan for 4 years, the vibe and the food is most welcome. The soup for ramen is of course not at Japanese street food level but it's still very very good. Katsu don is also on point. Takoyaki is a pass though #bummer

NTId4_aLmCle9cZCBtmA9Q.text: Amazing!!! I have been a long time "monta" patron and I think I have found a formidable contender. The soup was sooooooo good the miso is bomb! More choices for toppings, inexpensive for the quality and the broth was cleaner and leaner. Not so fatty... Plus the service was outstanding! The darling server brought out my little baby of 20 months his own bowl and baby utensils..  So good, I'll be back very very soon.

BVPIsRppCHQF8OISFwJ9uQ.text: Delicious, the spicy miso was very spicy but very flavorful. This place is just great for Ramen. Highly recommend it!

uuGx5Znh0muvtcZBc1ksqA.text: I really enjoyed this shop. It's small and intimate with great service and I loved their music. Nice band relaxing and great service. I enjoyed the ramen and so did everyone else in my party. Everyone commented that it was one of the best they have had. Will be returning!

ey4oyCpdjFZy9Qg-O5it8g.text: Spicy Miso - yummmmm.  Spicy Tonkostso - yummmmmm.  Excellent ramen ... this isn't your college 5 for a dollar ramen ........  this is your good Vegas ramen.

LCnqVsRqplUk-CgWQWpOJA.text: SO. FREAKING. GOOD!!!!!   Ramen Tatsu is a tiny, dark restaurant in the corner of the parking lot that houses District One. The ramen here is out of this world-- Monta does not even come close to comparing. The broth is incredible (I always get the Shoyu and add an extra egg) and the noodles taste fresh. Pricing is awesome (around $7-8 for a bowl of fresh ramen), most include pork, egg and onion, and the portion sizes are great.  I can't appreciate ramen anywhere besides Ramen Tatsu anymore because of how good it is. The woman who waits on the tables and runs the register (i assume shes the owner and I've only ever had one server there) is also super polite, attentive, warm and welcoming.   I only have great things to say about this place!

Gv3To_N0P2S3ecA5F3GbnA.text: It was ok. Wasn't that impressed. My husband and I we're both craving for ramen and we wanted to try this place out. Wait wasn't too long. It was when we started to order, brought our food out, drinks we're missing. I had to keep calling the waitress because she kept forgetting to bring us what we needed. No utensils, no straw, and i think she didn't know how to multitask but she even left her dirty towel that they used to wipe all the tables. Like literally it was right next to my water, i had to move it myself. Food was ok, Monta Ramen's still way better

jmbTcGJbBef-Pr5MaIdzOQ.text: Monta Ramen used to be my go-to location for ramen in Vegas, but it's now Ramen Tatsu. I'm a bit of a ramen "snob" and have to admit I was very impressed by the flavor of the dashi and the noodle quality.  I will definitely be going back here whenever I'm in Vegas!

b6SfYtLL9Hf6Jt0Ks-3G4A.text: Favorite ramen joint in town. I'm there about once a week. Try the tsukemen, my favorite, but all the different types are delicious. Great service and prices.

GM1qPrTJGmC6km3u_dsUdw.text: Boooooom savory ramen! I'm biased because I love noodle soups, but the broth and ingredients inside were so delicious! Wasn't a huge fan of the appetizers, but I'm sure there are some good ones!

Akdpr8Gc1-JUxqeVUGRv1A.text: Went here with my brother yesterday and was impressed with the food and service. I had the spicy tonkotsu Ramen and the tsukemen. The tonkotsu was silky and the chashu was perfectly cooked. The tsukemen was equally good. The taste may be intense for some but ask for some hot water to thin out the dipping broth if you need to. Overall a great experience and I will go back.

r5CsZKkI0zCJOd6l1fFgYA.text: This place was amazing! It was my first time here and the staff was super nice with helping me pick out yummy food to eat! Will be coming back for sure!

GBx1rNjXnwE2loDXCpMdwg.text: Came in here to try tsukemen for the first time with K.O. Saw a episode of mind of a chef where David Chang goes to Japan to each a lot of ramen and tsukemen being one of them.   So when we got in we noticed tsukemen wasn't anywhere on the menu. The waitress told us that when they received the noodles for the tsukemen it was the wrong kind and will be another month of so till they the new noodles. Not sure what rake so long to get different noodles.   So we decided to just try the regular ramen and it was full of disappointment. May have been the worst ramen I had.   We ordered the smoked chasu to share and I got the Tonkatsu shoyu ramen with garlic chip and egg add-ons.   Smoked chasu was very flavorful and delicious. Meat quality was decent and the spicy sauce and the garlic on the side was a nice addition. Now on to the ramen.   The broth - very light, kind of bland, and had a weird aftertaste.   Noodles -  wasn't bad, wasn't great. I prefer the thinner noodles for Tonkatsu shoyu normally but decided to try it with thick since that is what they normally serve with this ramen  Chasu - the chasu in the ramen is of worse quality than the smoked chasu. It is probably some of the worst chasu I have had in ramen. Just looking at it you can tell the meat is of subpar quality.   Garlic chips - I liked the crunchiness of the chips, but seemed a little overcooked to me.   Service was good though and the workers were very friendly and that's the reason for the 2 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Ramen Tatsu - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tonkatsu shoyu ramen with garlic chips and egg

HuChbDP6l3h4ZXxxSEQHVA.text: Ramen Tatsu is the best you can get. Period. The staff is friendly and on point. The food is amazing!! I personally prefer the Extra Spicy Miso, as that is my favorite! But the Spicy tonkatsu is my second favorite (I love it hot) :) either one will have you sleeping in the booth. I feel like this ramen is made with love and soul. I know it sounds corny, but they take great pride in their work. I've become a regular here and so have many of my friends and family. Plus I'm from Hawaii. Ramen and Saimin is something all of us know. Try it, you won't regret it.  P.S. Order one to go, you're gonna want it later. Pro tip.  -2soup Midgley

-HXznDcwWzOf5cuc_4YBeg.text: I usually come in and order the Tonkotsu Shoyo made extra spicy with garlic chips added into it.  I love that combo since there is a very decent level of the spice (I am a spice-holic) that melds so well with the garlic chips.  I keep meaning to go and try out the other ramen there, but it's too difficult for me to deviate from it!

They seem to be a different style of ramen than to Sora's Sapporo style, yet they are pretty good for the price that they offer. I do like sora the best still, but their tonkotsu ramen is yummy as they make sure you get enough kikugage and green onions. Their chasui bowl is just average, so you can probably skip this one.

iglhk9x3pYUJ-uBdN2hTkA.text: Apparently I've been to this spot twice now, but I can't remember much about the taste of the ramen I had a few years back. My uncle and I came here because our favorite place, Yagyu, closed down. My recent visit I actually ordered Tsukemen. I don't believe I have ever tried tsukemen before, so I don't have anything to compare it to, but I was pleasantly surprised with my order. With tsukemen, your noodles come out on the side, and you dip the noodles into a broth that's thicker and more flavorful than regular ramen broth.  They allow you to order 3x or more noodles servings for just a few bucks more; I went with 2x. Noodles are thicker than typical ramen and very chewy which I normally don't like for ramen, but went very well with tsukemen. Toppings included the standard chashu, egg, etc., and a wedge of lime. There seems to be only one kind of broth for the tsukemen, which I believe was tonokotsu shoyu with bonito. I'll have to get the tsukemen again the next time I'm visiting Vegas!

JBNBaUbqlY9X4Wny1LQZoA.text: Awesome authentic ramen with very friendly service at an affordable price. I've tried their tsukemen which was glorious and their tonkatsu ramen which was alright. Their chicken karage also uses high quality big chunks of meat. For the tsukemen I recommend adding extra scallions and the garlic chips for flavor but the dipping sauce is already awesome by itself. They also have some great little art designs on their wall. Highly recommend!

4CW-1V8U0oUKFXd9mF8OkQ.text: It was 9 o'clock and my boyfriend and I decided to go get tsukemen. Side story: I've been trying to find a good tsukemen place ever since I've tried the best tsukemen place back home on Hawaii. I've been craving it and good tsukemen is hard to find. Tsukemen is basically a dish that you dip noodles in thick tasty broth. Its really delicious. Back to the review: we came to ramen tatsu and the restaurant was 3/4 full of people. We waited a couple minutes and were seated. There was only one server but I have to say, she was on it. We ordered and it only took 5 minutes to get our food. It was very tasty and the portions given was a good amount. I only ate half and packed a to go container for home. I would definitely recommend people to try it if your looking for a different style of ramen!

myp-W1KFGkejI24qLP-vXA.text: I was visiting family in Nevada for a week and only had time for one ramen place, so I went here.  I was not disappointed.  I was stationed in Japan with the Navy for a year, so the ramen shops there are the standard on which I base all ramen places.  Ramen Tatsu might as well have been airlifted from Japan and deposited in Las Vegas.  I had the spicy tonkatsu - amazing!  Just the right amount of spiciness so that your nose runs a little, and the perfect tonkatsu flavor.  They also have Asahi on draft, which paired well with the ramen.  If I'm ever back in Vegas, I'll be back at Ramen Tatsu.

xDrIK-BTRpTLH3qAopfDig.text: This place is just a bit off the main China town area and there's no waiting line. We all ordered the Shoyu ramen and it's perfect for me and it is cheap also. The broth is just right, the meat just melts in your mouth and the egg is yummy. I wish there'll be some beansprout though. The service is nice and quick. Nice place for a ramen that doesn't have to wait for long line.

cwBa8D2H0ZcHEzPxm2Dlsg.text: Great value. Small and quaint restaurant. There are 2 TVs that had football and the music was smooth and calming. I ordered the deluxe ramen with mild spice and it was perfect. Just the right amount of kick where you could sip on your soup without burning your throat. The tonkatsu appetizer was nice and crunchy with a lot of meat. Our server was very attentive. Bathrooms are single stalled but clean and fresh. There's a happy hour Monday through Friday as well.

8njt_iCvV5AHC5I4B-wqAQ.text: Okay peeps. I don't usually write many reviews, but... this place is the bomb. At first my daughter and I was unsure about the other reviews because we were not sure if mainlanders idea of ramen is the same as HAWAII people's ideas.   Well let me tell you HAWAII people and all people with taste buds, this place is ONO!  So if you from our beautiful islands, you can rest assured this is a great place to get ramen.   Don't forget to get charsu cause it is one of the best charsu that I've eaten in all of my life. And that's saying a lot as I don't really care for pork. The outside has a little crisp and the jelly like heat reduced fat. Ummm. Sound like an oxymoron to say it wasn't oily fat, just ono.   Go try them. Gaurantee it's going to be one of your favs and easy on the wallet too!

2_vJrmtZlkcsS-5TLgY40g.text: Wife and I love this place. Monta and Jinya are good choices as well, but this place has got tsukamen, which is my go to. Each time we've gone, we've had great experiences. Ramen is on point, service is awesome, and we always enjoy the music.

tDXxLmfWq_v2kn55eIp7kw.text: This place is simply amazing. I am a huge fan of ramen and this place does not disappoint. They have Tonkatsu, Shoyu and Miso ramen just to name a few. I had the Tonkatsu and it was just amazing. The Shoyu ramen broth is a bit thinner and more mild than the Tonkatsu, so make sure and have a good idea of what you want when you come here. The pork in the ramen was very flavorful and tasty. You can add things like corn and extra additions if you like as well. We also had the dumplings and they were amazing.  The service was fantastic and the people working there could not have been nicer.   I will definitely be coming back here in the future. There are a ton of ramen places in this area, but this is one of the best.  Highly recommended!

NNQae2nt61513eAinJ3H3A.text: This spot is probably my favorite go-to ramen place. It's tucked in a small storefront in the plaza, so it can be a bit hard to spot if you don't know what you're looking at. When you enter the restaurant, you're almost instantaneously greeted by the server. Usually, they only have one on duty, but they always provide stellar service (and they're always really nice!).  When it comes to the food, I have absolutely no complaints. Their ramen is great. I've had them all (even the vegetarian one which is surprisingly good). They have the perfect level of richness and creaminess without it being too overwhelming and the broth isn't overly salty. Their curry is also pretty tasty and very filling. Their menu has decent variety and happy hour appetizers are a great deal.  Totally recommend this is as a very chill and casual ramen joint.

UCbVpEe76LdewsqgyPTkCQ.text: So my favorite spot Misoya closed down and idk why but I heard it failed an inspection? Anyways   This place had high ratings so I brought my ramen partner and drove here. 4.5 stars? Can't go wrong! The interior was very appealing with lots of Christmas decorations for the season. There was one floor person who was seating and serving at least 20 people. Kudos to her.  This ramen spot is in a very busy plaza outside of China town that includes J Karaoke, Chada Thai, District 1, and Chinese BBQ AKA parking sucks on the weekend.  Their menu includes more than just ramen: appetizers, curry, and other Japanese dishes.   I got their karaage and gyoza to start and for my ramen I chose their deluxe ramen with all the fixings. At $10.99 it was a very reasonable price. This includes 3 slices of chashu, corn, cabbage, and some sort of fungus. Basically I didn't dig the broth. I haven't been to many ramen places to compare: Fukumimi, Monta, Misoya, And Jimya. Personally it just didn't have as much flavor and it just didn't taste good to me. I can see it appealing to certain people but my idea of ramen was not this. The chashu was flavorful, but not fall apart delicious.  As a saving grace their gyoza was extremely delicious. This was a stand out for me. The karaage was pretty good too but nothing to write home about.   Service was okay/sweet, prices are about the same as everywhere, space/environment was nice, but ramen was just okay.  I would return to try a non-ramen dish, but I'm not in a hurry.

n1SdnTnKXM4iV6I2981kXw.text: I got to introduce my wife to Ramen today, and what a better place to do it than here. She got the tonkatsu and I got the tonkatsu shoyu. We both got extra noodles but ended up not eating them, as there were tons of noodles in our bowls to begin with!   For apps we had a small fried rice and the gyoza. The tonkatsu ramen soup was shimmered and seasoned with perfection. I literally slurp the bowl with a straw leaving nothing behind. Fried rice was evenly cooked , flipped that every grain of rice was seasoned.  Honestly the best fried rice I've had for a long time.  You won't regret coming here!

hd0xjKPHCINw5S7uAXW1EQ.text: X marks the spot when it comes to good service, here at Ramen Tatsu. I arrived at opening time this past Sunday (02/12 at 11:30), and was greeted by a young, very bright and enthusiastic female server, who told me I could sit anywhere; I chose the booth closest to the door.   She immediately placed a full water glass and menu on my table, then went about some other duties. When I was ready to order she magically appeared and efficiently took my order, repeated it back to me for confirmation and whisked away to the back with my menu in tow. All the while, more customers were filing in to the place, and she didn't miss a beat with any of them.   In good time, she returned with a steaming bowl of miso ramen and a small plate of chahan (I chose regular fried rice over kimchi fried rice). The chahan was decent, with a nice bit of wok flavor (I dropped the left over chahan at my mother's, and she thought it was excellent), and the miso ramen was just what I needed after a couple days of hard driving. The broth was hot, flavorful, with firm noodles, plenty of bean sprouts, corn, green onion and chasshuu. While it wasn't as good as a bowl of Misoya Tomi's miso ramen (they're actually closed now), it was pretty dang good. The highlight of the dish was the chasshuu, with excellent flavor in the lean part, and of course, a lot of flavor on the fatty part, which was plentiful.   After drinking the bowl dry, I pushed the bowl away and almost immediately after, the server dropped the check at my table, and asked me if I wanted a box for the left overs. When she returned with the box, she parted with a warm/polite "thank you".   The industry needs more servers like her. I hope this server, and many more like her, decide to make it their role in life to do this job, and do it well - especially in small, hole-in-the-wall places like Ramen Tatsu. Who knows, maybe she's the owner, and if so, thank God.

photos.caption: Photo of Ramen Tatsu - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miso Ramen, Reg. Chahan, and beni shouga in the small container.

04GQKjp3ChBeA7YFKAUTHw.text: Tried it for the first time today. And best flavor ramen in Vegas hands down. The flavor was amazing, price was decent not out of this world like other places prices.  They have different spice flavors, I got the entry level which is 2 higher than the spicy but there are 3 flavors spicier. And let me tell you, the entry level was hotter than any other ramens hottest spice level! And I have done spicy noodle challenges around Vegas and non was compared to Ramen Tastu.

vlgbXdOO-HXPNwe2lnhrJA.text: I'm not so superstitious but that stuff does make me curious.  Good tasty fulfilling ramen starts at $7.77. Add toppings for $0.77.  Seven ingredients: Tonkatsu shoyu broth, ramen noodles, chasiu, mushrooms, green onion, soft eggs, and garlic chips.  Satisfying!    Ate here a couple times and both visits were cuz I had a cold.  Normally hot chicken soup with hearty veggies will comfort me.  That's a saying...  Something about their ramen here will do the job just as well.  Those garlic chips!  I know garlic is great for high blood pressure and colds.  Can't say this is the absolute remedy for feeling under the weather.  But my ear was clogged up for three days and the head cold was just hanging out.  It needs to leave.  Ramen Tatsu to the rescue!  In the morning, my ear finally drained.  I can hear!  This is just my take on their soup.  I do love it.  It's affordable and tastes really good.  I don't leave leftovers.  I have my fave ingredients for my cold remedy I suppose.  It works so I'll stick with it.  How's that?  :)

photos.caption: Photo of Ramen Tatsu - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ramen with Ness
Photo of Ramen Tatsu - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Takoyaki
Photo of Ramen Tatsu - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Both are mine - happy hour :P

cxoP30rcmf8ectthmhMGKA.text: Cool Ramen spot! Not very big and had an awesome atmosphere!   The decor felt like I was in Japan. Cool Japanese decorations and they even have 2 tv's. I was able to enjoy watching a NFL game while having dinner.  The staff is super nice! They made sure we were well taken cared off and followed up with us to make sure everything was ok.  Let's get down with the food! I had the Katsu Curry! I know i know why order Katsu Curry at a Ramen joint but the picture in the menu got me! I knew I had to try it! The bowl was huge and the curry was not too spicy! The chicken was juicy and crust had a nice texture.   Overall I enjoyed this place! I liked that it was intimate and staff gave great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Ramen Tatsu - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Katsu Curry

n-bLJbSYT2bIb1GnWPiI9w.text: I love eating Japanese ramen noodles no matter what time of year it is. Sure, that goes for any delicious soup out there, but some of my friends think I'm weird eating hot soup on a hot summer day. I went to a place once and they only serve ramen during the winter season - Boo!  My favorite broth here is their tonkotsu infused with shoyu. Love this savory and somewhat creamy broth without being too salty. What a wonderful option that I am able to choose thin or thick noodles with my soup. They give you good portions of noodles unlike other places that skimp on it. Depending on the soup you order, it comes with basic toppings and add ons are extra charge.  I'm not sure if I come here because of their soup or because they have one tasty fried rice and chicken karage that pair well together. I love the condiments on the table which add flavor to the chicken karage as a dipping sauce.   The service here is always excellent even when it's usually one gal working solo in the dining area. The older lady is my favorite server. She's cute and always has positive energy when she's serving my table. I love how this place is so warm and inviting! I like seeing the wall decor they put up and the dark wood throughout adds warmth.   This place also has a family friendly atmosphere compared to other ramen joints where lots of hipsters hang out and therefore tends to be noisy. This place is smaller than the other ramen joints around the valley. That's another reason why I like to dine here giving it a more personal space while I slurp my savory bowl of goodness.

9jLxaKV-de4GJehvlV9dMQ.text: We had the Tonkotsu Shoyu Ramen and the Katsu Curry.  However, I prefer the Ramen over at Monta and the Katsu Curry at Tonkotsu Kiyoshi.  The chasiu was still cold...not rich and delectable at Monta.  The Katsu was dry and the curry was too thin.  This ramen shop is more spacious than Monta and the service was good.    Also, they do not have that spicy seasoning on the side, or the jar of pickled radish or pickled ginger on the table to add to your soup/entree as other places do.  Overall, it is ok, but not enough for me to return.

VXFc6P3Ct2u8X2PjUsiVcw.text: The restaurant is really small, but the seating is really comfortable. The ramen here is 7 to 10 bucks each and they are really delicious. I also really like the curry katsu.  The owner of the restaurant is a small Japanese woman- she is so sweet and also provides me with the best service!   Of the many ramen spots I've visited, this is my favorite ramen spot in Las Vegas.

A-9B4-RoJDTp_J1o-1rSQw.text: Amazing find. The broth is amazing. Spicy miso. If ur into spicy food, yes. If can't handle the heat, just the miso is ok too.

1C70UcvvOEeB5mE6kS3eMw.text: The best ramen I've had in the world. Broth is powerful and so flavorful. Kim chi is clear from perfect fermentation. And spicy bean sprouts are cooked to perfection. Egg is delicious. Parking lot is way too busy but it's worth the headache. I recommend parking in the lot next door and walking over.

3DV9wvGLfNkVNqn7yPIhjQ.text: This restaurant has average ramen. The broth is flavorful, the noodles have a good bite to them, and the chasiu is tender. But overall, there was nothing memorable about the ramen. The restaurant is small and the staff is friendly though, which is a plus in my book.   If you are near the area, this is a good place to get your Ramen fix if you are really craving it!

oiarc72aiXXJdSfq4DfJLA.text: Absolutely delicious! We order quite a few items as I'm just getting home from the hospital and wanted food test to eat in the house. My God that fried rice! I'm in love with it! Perfect for take out not much as far as seating or environment. The service was exceptional! Prices are to low for the food!! Great curry and excellent ramen! I ate myself silly! G7x5W0uQIAjjY312vhNGHQ.text: I'm a little embarrassed to say that before this place I thought ramen was the dry block you eat when you are a poor college student. I knew coming to Vegas where there were many ramen choices, that I had to try the real thing. Sora and Monta seemed to be the #1 and 2 places for ramen. However, this place had great reviews and I wanted to try somewhere that wasn't the most popular. Wanted to give the little guys a chance.   We ordered the Tonkotsu Shoyu and Curry. Both were tasty but the Curry was our favorite. The broth was amazing. I still think about the broth and want some right now! It tasted homemade, flavorful and fresh. No complaints at all about the food.  I don't remember our server's name, but she was an older lady. She was very kind and on top of everything. She gave us great service.  I was overwhelmed here in Chinatown with all the choices. Glad I chose this place.

fY8Vy0faMwziwOOCTgPUeA.text: Ramen Tatsu has become my go to place for Ramen. It's ramen matches the best in the city. Whether it's the Shoryu, or Tonkotsu, the broth it first rate. The noodles are perfectly cooked. It's relaxed. There's no line. The sides are first rate. The owners are really nice. What's not to love. There are other places I go for something particular they offer, but when it's just about a relaxed nice bowl of ramen, you can't do better than here. I understand there can be a line, but I've not hit it.

9m0c0KCNnsABuphyc8qdNg.text: Great food and friendly staff. My wife, toddler, and I came to check out this place while we were in Las Vegas, NV. We really enjoyed our food and the atmosphere. From the moment we walked in the door, we were made to feel welcome. The staff greeted us and asked us to sit anywhere we would like. Almost immediately, our waitress asked us what we wanted to drink. We were also given water, that to my surprise, tasted like filtered water and not just tap. The food was good. Wholesome and fresh ingredients. The seasoning is light, but there are sauces available upon request. Kudos to this restaurant!

Ex_6FN-jzmrf1CP4mnoh1Q.text: Ordered:  Spicy Tonkatsu ramen - added egg  The service is always awesome! Super friendly and very attentive. The ramen was very delicious and the spice level is adjustable. They make the soup spicy with their homemade concoction of ghost chili and habanero. I love spicy food so this was a big plus!! Sooo good!!

oNP5IUg5tAoSd8bjoB0C-g.text: Super cute little place. When we got there, they were a little busy and offered us the bar seating and we took it then once a booth became available, they asked us if we wanted to move...which I thought that was super nice. I had the Curry Ramen ! And....OMG, it was amazing! It was so flavorful and the meat was so tender. It was seriously great. I had the coffee macaroon ice cream sandwich, which was cute and yummy

yHPEHXxzHAwiVWWolxngbw.text: I hate being a hater but that was a 2 star experience.  They can't compete with the big boys down the street.    My wife got the tonkotsu ramen and while the broth was decent, they gave her thin noodles which she didn't like at all.  The server didn't even offer a choice and the thick noodles in my deluxe were way better.  The deluxe definitely wasn't skimpy on ingredients but the broth was bland and the charsiu was just OK.  I would have ordered the deluxe with tonkotsu ramen or shoyu (soy sauce) if I could do it again.    What's up with no music in the restaurant?  I felt like I was eating ramen in a library.  Is 3 stars the new 2 stars?  Even the 3 star reviews are telling readers to go elsewhere.

Signature broth cooked for hours with pork head, cuts are pork shoulder not belly...details, baby!  With our favorite Thai place remodeling, it's a no brainer where we're going.

uSltpfllo-biEPRcmXWF8Q.text: This place is awesome. Great flavors and great people. Prices are on point. Their spicy ramen is a definite go to. We always frequent this place when we are in Vegas.

The chicken Karage is crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside The staffs are friendly and service is excellent. Loveeee their Happy hour!!!  Highly recommend this ramen joint to all

NXAerpqDc6xWJMghMmmzSQ.text: It's been a long time since I've tried a new ramen place. Jinya and Sora are my usual to go's for ramen. But I wanted to try somewhere new and promote our ramen culture ! Coming into this small corner shop that is in a busting popular shopping center from the cold was a delight. The shop is full of homely decor, and while we visited full of Christmas knicknacks. The staff were kind and sweet, making sure we were comfortable. Even though it was just my boyfriend and I the insisted we switched to a larger table to more comfortable. So sweet ! Once we got our menus we were drooling! Not only did everything look good but it was bang for your buck! Usually, Sora is my top choice for cheaper ramen but these prices blew it out of the water. Not only that but once we ordered our ramens, I the Shio and my bf the Tonkotsu Shoyu we were amazed. These blew Sora's out of water for us. Their eggs were much better seasoned, a big swing for us. Their broth was incredibly more flavorful. We also got some gyoza, another favorite of ours. It was very tasty, the searing making it just the perfect type of crispy. It was a bit too garlicy for me but I overall enjoyed the appetizer. This place surely will be our spot for cheap ramen and trust me the taste will not be cheap at all!

B9Ac5tbln4C_tceEIav36w.text: I'm a newbie to ramen but I'm quickly getting addicted.  Due to Cafe de Cebu's continuous bad service... The tonkatsu broth was tasty and the ramen was cooked al dente. The bad side was that there were only two pieces of pork and I was left still feeling hungry.  I guess I must have been starving or I just need a side of extra noodles.  Overall, I liked Tatsu ramen and I'm hoping they reopen soon. 6bzilNd77xiKxgD4x08sxA.text: Great ramen! This is my new go to place in Vegas. Very good service as well. Two thumbs up.

NzybvgskBFK4li0p7VCaEg.text: I had the Tonkotsu Shoyu Ramen.  It was ok, but I do prefer the ramen over at Ramen Sora.  The broth at Sora is tastier and the meat quality is better.  However, the service was great and it may be easier for you to find a parking spot at Tatsu because of all the other shops and restaurants around.  The restaurant is pretty small but I went on a Saturday afternoon and there were still a couple of tables free.  Overall, Ramen Tatsu is good but I probably would not come back because I like Ramen Sora   much better.

nB6zegho20jDdxBDIfZmHg.text: Yummy! Much better compared to Ichi Ramen. Small intimate restaurant. Worth the drive.

6l0YoZdLmf41oBSzZ5qIpw.text: First time here and definitely be back. Ramen had a great taste and service was fast even with just one server, she had a great happy energy.

yr3S4uMGwkVeXRjmu6zrew.text: The ramen here is just amazing. My husband had the spicy sesame cold ramen and I had the curry ramen. They both were very good with plenty of flavor and not too salty. Comparing to the price that I'm used to in Washington, DC, the price here is great and they gave you plenty of food.   Now I see why many unemployed west coast people that moved out east complain about Asian food on the east coast.

fimjuSKBdvAQpgA0wol8Ag.text: Accidentally visit here since my boyfriend favorite spot next door Asian BBQ noodle was closed.   My boyfriend ordered a miso ramen, he's thought its was average. The service was friendly and helpful

Emu_osPOQPZhe_T7xeRkiA.text: Quick and fast!  The broth (dashi) is very good!  Always come off the plane to have a meal here!

gY2KRjdbUky7E74epuBWpQ.text: Better price than the other "best ramen places" but not as overwhelmingly salty.  Definitely be back, especially during happy hour (3-6 tues-fri)

VmtMlciH2t2aLbkFNQk0-w.text: Came here to try the tsukemen ramen and I loved it! Fishy, salty, intense broth to dip your thick ramen noodles in! It was my first time trying this type of ramen since I've already tried all the other ramen places in town (Monta, Sora) and I would definitely come back to have tsukemen again! They have the regular order for $10.77 and a double noodle order for $12.77. I got the regular order and when I finished my noodles and still had plenty of broth left I regretted not doing the double noodles order :( the broth was so good, I really wanted to sip on it but alas it's too salty without the noodles.  The charsiu that accompanied it was soft and delicious.  We also ordered the kaarage and it was seasoned just right, crunchy on the outside and moist on the inside. The mister had the miso ramen with butter and he devoured his bowl. He also complimented on how great the charsiu was! He also finished the broth in his bowl so that says something since he's normally not a soup person!  They also serve green tea (iced or hot), that does not come out of a can and you get free refills.  Overall we had a great lunch! Would definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of Ramen Tatsu - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cute little ramen place, refills on green tea and the tsukemen ramen was delish!

FM-bXrMhZQQWOOgqApBlsQ.text: Delish, similar to more traditional Japanese Ramen. The price was on point less than $25 for 2 people.   I had the Tonkatsu Curry. It was so filling. Wish I lived in the area so I could enjoy this meal more often.   Waitress was so happy and friendly! Couldn't ask for better service

5wDv9BWyYQIZsVB5eZ-sEA.text: So far been here for fifteen minutes. One waitress running around, not even acknowledging anyone that walks in. Not even eye contact as she walks by. Some guy in the back came out, scanned the dining area, and glanced over at waiting area. Not even a smile or acknowledgment. Lots of seats available. Horrible service already and I haven't even made my order. So... am i supposed to seat myself?

xtV3MNqcHQtQ8c9ULhwo2A.text: This ramen spot is now my favorite spot to eat ramen. When I think about ramen in Vegas, I think of Ramen Tatsu because of all the variety of broths they provide. I have only tried two out of several broths (Shio and Tonkotsu Shoyu) and I love the lightness of the soup. Its not over buttered and doesn't feel so heavy. It doesn't leave that fatty taste at the end of the meal. I also love the noodles which are cooked to perfection. The chashu pieces are thicker than most places and tastes like real pork that you can actually chew on and enjoy the flavor.  The takoyaki is also good with just the right amount of  batter and crunch. I love how they dont add too much mayo. Beautiful little babies! The restaurant is spacious and the music they play is relaxing and smooth and adds a cafe feel to it.  They also have curry and a saborro bowl which i have yet to try. Definitely need to try this place out! The service is also amazing. They replace your water before you run out and they are really nice and friendly. And I love how its not as crowded and busy as monta or sora but they its not an empty restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Ramen Tatsu - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chasiu bowl and shrimp sumai: A+

Photo of Ramen Tatsu - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZyKHy1wztsX4XqglznUP7Q.text: I am a fan of chicken ramen and Tatsu did justice. If you are into lighter ramen with less salt and oil, go for the Shio that is made from chicken broth. I like a little yuzu refreshing taste in the soup. I wish the broth was a little hotter because the ramen turned cold quickly. The noodles were firm. I prefer the noodles a bit chewier and have more bite. Tatsu is generous with their portion and toppings. I added bean sprouts and kimchi on the side. It was such a steal for .77 cent for so much toppings.

HgUdrFlF3b_YwZ-7QPeIOw.text: You walk in and you are greeted by the strong sodium scent and fresh noodles. I waited less than a minute to be seated in the bar. My server was really pleasant and she was attentive to all my needs. I got the pork belly ramen and I thought it was too salty. I've tried other ramen places before and this one didn't really stand out to me. Maybe my taste buds don't really find salty soup appetizing. I personally prefer the beef broth in pho. I also got the chicken karange (I'm pretty sure that's not how you spell it) and I thought it was just alright - I've had better ones before. Why I'm giving this place 4 stars is simply because of my server. She did an amazing job. She was wearing the best accessory anyone could have - her extremely contagious smile. She was like that with all her customers which obviously made up for my salty food. If you prefer ramen over pho, then I'm sure you'll enjoy this Japanese Restaurant.

Cn-jle99b9MBJw0DHI4Qig.text: Always eat here with my hubby, cold noodles is in season, I like the yuzu soyo cold noodle. Really refreshing.

6Yo3sirKvN11XY2ZvuCpkg.text: First time coming here and I loved it! The ramen was delicious and the service was excellent! Our waitress was so fast and precise with everything. The spicy miso ramen was perfect. The regular tonkotsu ramen was very tasty and the sliced pork was tender and delicious.

SQY8byCN6_S9GHL75LVrug.text: An amazing meal! Best Ramen I've ever had. This is a Vegas gem. And the macaroons are a great way to finish.

z05PWpZayvyQqDszZi4d0g.text: Delicious! Big portions. I liked my tonakasu bowl. My sister got the spicy miso, which way too spicy to enjoy. Our server was crazy nice and funny. They also have HH. I think its better than monta.

qNvEdYKijw6Fllg_rV6pWA.text: Not a long wait like monta!!  My friend and i decided to check out a ramen place we havent gone to in vegas before heading home.  This place didnt have a wait and we were seated right away.   Their menu is pretty simple-  ramen choices, some appetizers and rice plates.  The 3 stars is purely for the one of the better curry's i've had. The curry almost reminds me of this meat sauce but curry flavored! They have ground meat in the curry that adds more texture and flavor to the rice plate.   The ramens were so-so. Soup base is definitely better at monta imo, but if you're hungry and hungover for some soup and dont want to tolerate the long wait at monta, this place might be a good idea.

FNkSNZiJFdE3_iCZi9z6_g.text: Bun and I got upset tummy's after our 2nd time going...immediately after coming home and eating this for dinner

F1TuyWRPWorY2jURY0G6Zg.text: Great ramen at the end of a long road trip on a chilly night. Did not try any others in the area but  something of a ramen fiend in NYC and southern California. Thus compares just fine to both in terms of the broth, yum! I like the noodles that came with my spicy tonkatsu just fine, but not a fan of the noodles that came with the plain tonkatsu. Service was very good.

rxMp_wlLIxSehU_aSgDMhA.text: My first time at Tatsu, we had Gyoza, miso ramen and spicy Tonkotsu ramen. Everything was amazing!!! Especially cha-shu pork ( of course hose made!), it's melt in your mouth. Miso ramen was so tasty, it is hard to find really good miso ramen. I have tried so many miso ramen because it's my favorite :) but they usually tasted like miso soup, or no flavor... Miso ramen at Tatsu is very flavorful, if you like authentic Japanese ramen, you must try Tatsu! I also loved their Maneki-Neko collection. They are so cute!!!

eBdqXN2sAov19Y-okUSQBw.text: Pleasant surprise! Fast service and good ramen.

lWjzEGZs1m8Ag_qCbuQHoA.text: Awesome ramen and service! I had the medium spicy miso and hubby had the combination. The broth for both was really good, especially the combination ramen. Noodles are nice and al dente, and the charsiu was soft and tasty. Compared to our most horrible ramen ever at Itsy Bitsy Ramen and Whiskey the other week, Ramen Tatsu wins hands down. Oh wait, not forgetting to mention that the one, single waitress in there during dinner rush, with her cutesy Japanese accent... she was on it, she single handedly bussed and served and checked people out, was very quick while carrying hot bowls of ramen. She was very polite never forgetting to greet and thank all the customers! We're going back again.

3ZME9_tk6nMj70mFQ_CO-w.text: I've been to many different ramen places this would be my second choice. They don't have variety of toppings. The flavor was good. The ramen noodles were different from other ramen spots this was more closer to cu of noodles lol but I would go back again.
